problem.markdown:
Which of the following programming paradigms is the most powerful? ( ) Functional ( ) Imperative ( ) Object-Oriented ( ) Declarative (x) All equally powerful
[explanation] Surprisingly, they're all equally powerful! There's nothing you can't do in one that you couldn't do in another. It is the case that some times a particular problem is easier to do in one language vs. another -- which is one reason why there are so many languages out there, another is that language design is really fun -- but it's nice to know that the choice of language you pick for a problem doesn't constrain whether you can do something, only how efficiently you can put it together. [explanation]
